body_html: The easiest way is to use cupy like in https://github.com/szagoruyko/pyinn or https://github.com/salesforce/pytorch-qrnn, but the best practice for code that could eventually be merged into PyTorch master would be to add an ATen native function like ROI pooling here.
body_text: The easiest way is to use cupy like in https://github.com/szagoruyko/pyinn or https://github.com/salesforce/pytorch-qrnn, but the best practice for code that could eventually be merged into PyTorch master would be to add an ATen native function like ROI pooling here.
body: The easiest way is to use cupy like in https://github.com/szagoruyko/pyinn or https://github.com/salesforce/pytorch-qrnn, but the best practice for code that could eventually be merged into PyTorch master would be to add an ATen native function like ROI pooling [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/cuda/NativeFunctionsCuda.cu#L37).
